page.title: 04Housing south: FINTRY
page.content:
The oldest part of the village occurs around the road junction at Gonachan Cottage. What remains of the original settlement has been modernised. This is the site of Fintry's first school.
The stretch by the Kirk, saving the old manses, also consists of cottages improved and modernised. Even the Clachan Hotel had such a humble start.
The Main Street which traverses Fintry Cross used to be New Town Fintry. It has also been largely modernised or, as in the case of the council flats, rebuilt. There has also been some infilling with new properties.
Over the bridge on the Kippen Road the council estate extends into this square. Completely post-war built some houses are now privately owned.
